label: Trans_00_Introduction
text: ï¿½ï¿½Transformers that are designed for installing at outdoor are outdoor transformers and transformers designed for installing at indoor are indoor transformer 4. Outdoor Transformer and Indoor Transformer. ï¿½ï¿½Former is generally used where ratio between high voltage and low voltage is greater than 2. It is cost effective to use later where the ratio between high voltage and low voltage is less than 4. Two Winding Transformer and Auto Transformer . ï¿½ï¿½Transformer is generally used in transmission network which is normally known as power transformer distribution transformer is use 3.Electrical Power Transformer Distribution Transformer and Instrument Transformer. ï¿½Former is gen 2.Three Phase Transformer and Single Phase Transformer. Generally used for stepping up and down the voltage level of power in transmission and distribution power network. 1. Step Up Transformer and Step Down Transformer. ï¿½ï¿½Transformers can be categorized in different ways depending upon their purpose use construction etc. The types of transformer are as follow Types of Transformer ï¿½HTwo winding transformers are generally used where ratio between high v ï¿½ï¿½ Generation of electrical power in low voltage level is very much cost effective. Hence electrical power is generated in low voltage level. Theoretically this low voltage level power can be transmitted to t Usage ï¿½;The history of transformer was commenced in the year 1880 History ï¿½ï¿½A transformer is a static machine used for transforming power from one circuit to another without changing frequency. This is a very basic definition of transforme Definition

label: Trans_02_cooling_type
text: ï¿½ODAF or oil di ODWF Cooling of Transformer ï¿½%ODAF or oil directed air forced coo ODAF Cooling of Transformer ï¿½ï¿½We know that ambient temperature of water is much less than the atmospheric air in same weather condition. So water may be used as better heat exchanger media than air. In OFWF OFWF Cooling of Transformer ï¿½ The heat dissipation rate ca ï¿½ï¿½In oil forced air natural cooling system of transformer the heat dissipation is accelerated by using forced air on the dissipating surface but circulation of the hot oil in transformer tank is natural convectional flo OFAF Cooling of Transformer ï¿½PHeat dissipation can obviously be increased if dissipating surface is increas ONAF Cooling of Transformer ï¿½ï¿½This is the simplest transformer cooling system. The full form of ONAN is Oil Natural Air Natural. Here natural convectional flow of hot oil is utilized for cooling. In convectional circulation of oil the hot oil flows to the upper portion of the tra ONAN Cooling of Transformer ï¿½=The main source of heat generation in transformer is its co Click image to fullscreen Transformer Cooling Methods

label: Trans_03_liquid_vs_dry
text: ï¿½u Transformers generally require minimal maintenance. Dry-type transformers require an annual inspection and cleani 8- Maintenance Considerations ï¿½@ As there are no radiator banks used in dry-type transformers 7- Installation Costs ï¿½ï¿½ Two critical considerations are transformer losses and size. Even though dry-type core and coils are larger than the equivalent l 6- Performance Comparison ï¿½ï¿½ When searching for a transformer one constructed with quality components is critical. Choose a supplier with an established reputation who incorporates only the best insulation channels winding combs spacer sticks and standoff insulator 5- Transformer Construction ï¿½ï¿½ The most common insulation sheets used in liquid cooled transformers is cellulose-based paper. Both mineral oil and silicone have good dielectric characteristics which makes them suitable for ve 4- Insulation ï¿½ï¿½ Since the early 1970s PCBs have been linked with many health risks and their use is banned in almost all environmentally aware countries.When selecting a tran 2- Health Safety and Environmental Concerns ï¿½p For cost reasons transformers are located in habitable areas such as buildings where fire risk has to be mi 1- Fire Risks Considerations for Selecting a Transformer ï¿½ï¿½8- large reliability index and nowadays used in the form of complete substations inside a metallic enclosure having cable-connecting box in both the H.V and L.V side 7- High efficiency with good voltage regulation and noiseless. 6- completely secure from the view of fire environment pollution. 5- light so can be easily installed on the roof of the building . 4- Needs no accessories such as valves breathers and measuring devices of fluid immersed transformers. 3- Needs less maintenance and cyclic testing other than fluid immersed transformers. 2- Can be easily installed in buildings with complete security. 1- Cheapest fire proof transformers Advantages of dry type over liquid type ï¿½ï¿½air is used as the cooling and dielectric medium. Most are manufactured with vacuum pressure impregnation in polyester or silicone varnish. For tougher environmental conditions VPI epoxy sealed and cast resin transformers have also been develope 3- dry-type transformers ï¿½ï¿½ core and coils are immersed in a low boiling point fluid that evaporates taking transformer heat away as its latent heat and then returns in liquid form through condensation in the radiator tube 2- liquid vapor condensation transformers the cooling and dielectric media is a fluid which remains in a liquid state during the operation of the transformer. 1- liquid filled transformers Types of Transformers ï¿½ Dry vs. liquid transformers

label: Trans_041_opec_specs_detials
text: ï¿½-Waste Electrical and Electronics Equipment 9- WEEE Compliant ï¿½ï¿½The Germany-based VDE Testing and Certification Institute is accredited on a national and international level in the area of testing electrotechnical products. Testing is conducted for safety electromagnetic compatibility and other characteristic 8- VDE ï¿½ï¿½TÃV Rhineland Berlin-Brandenburg appraises tests and certifies technical equipment and products according to international quality standards and then registers those in complian 7- TUV Underwriters Laboratories Inc. (UL) is an independent not-for-profit product safety testing and certification organization. 6- UL ï¿½ï¿½The transformer satisfies U.S. military standards or specifications (MIL-SPEC). There are many testing standards associated with MIL standard 5- MIL-STD ï¿½ï¿½International Electrotechnical Commission (IEC) is the leading global organization that prepares and publishes international standards for all electrical electronic and related technologie 4- IEC ï¿½ï¿½Canadian Standards Association (CSA) establishes standards of safety for products and helps preserve the environment. CSA tests and certifies products for national in international companie 3- CSA ï¿½ï¿½American National Standards Institute (ANSI) does not itself develop American National Standards but it facilitates standards development by establishing consensus among qualified group 2- ANSI ï¿½ï¿½Restriction of Hazardous Substances (RoHS) is a European Union (EU) directive that requires all manufacturers of electronic and electrical equipment s 1- RoHS Compliant Other unlisted specialized or proprietary transformer mounting techniques. 9- Other ï¿½ï¿½Pole-mounted transformers are installed on top of poles and are normally used as distribution step-down transformers servicing houses located close b 8- Pole-Mounted ï¿½ï¿½Any of a variety of signal transformers mounted on PCBs. They can either be surface-mounted or through-hole configurations using the soldering method t 7- PC / PCB Mount ï¿½;Pad-mounted transformers are mounted on the ground sit 6-Pad-Mounted Magnetics incorporated into the RJ-45 form factor ensure high common mode noise immunity while maintaining signal integrity. 5-Modular Jack ï¿½ï¿½H-frame mounting is used in applications where high vibration or shock is present. It is an H shaped frame that the transformer sits on. The frame is secured to the chassis or boar 4- H-Frame ï¿½ï¿½A simple rubber washer and metal disk or dish secures the transformer to the chassis or board. There is usually a through-hole in the middle of the disk that allows for a screw to hold the transformer dow 3-Dish / Disk Mount ï¿½ï¿½Chip transformers have a form factor of an integrated circuit (IC) chip. They are typically manufactured using thin-film technolog 2-Chip Transformer A chassis-mounted transformer has tabs to facilitate screwing it down. 1-Chassis Mount Other unlisted specialized or proprietary transformer type. 27-Other A variac is an autotransformer with sliding tap. They are also known as variable autotransformers. 26-Variac / Variable Autotransformer ï¿½ï¿½In polyphase (3-phase) transformers the three primary windings are connected together and the three secondary windings are connected as wel 25-Three Phase / Polyphase Transformer Substation transformers are used in substation terminals where the incoming voltage is stepped up or down. 24-Substation Transformer The transformer is used in solar power applications. 23-Solar Power Transformer These are transformers that operate with single phase voltage. 22-Single Phase Transformer ï¿½ï¿½Resonant transformers operate at the resonant frequency of one of its coils (the primary or the secondary). They are used for arc welding discharge lamps et 21-Resonant Transformer ï¿½ï¿½Rectifier transformers produce a DC current or voltage. They drive a diode or a thyristor and are used in electrolysis and smelting application 20-Rectifier Transformer ï¿½ï¿½Power transformers convert one voltage to another at high power levels. Power transformers are used in electronic circuits and come in many different 19-Power Transformer ï¿½ï¿½Transformers used to provide earth reference points to underground electrical systems. The best way to ground a power system is to obtain the system neutral through a generator or transformer with a wye-connected windin 18-Neutral Grounding Transformer These transformers have several outputs. Each output corresponds to a different transformer ratio. 17-Multi-Ratio Transformer ï¿½ï¿½A transformer used in medical applications such as biomedical equipment in hospitals. There are many strict safety rules guidelines and laws governing the design construction and use of these transformer 16-Medical Transformer ï¿½Leakage (or s 15-Leakage Transformer ï¿½~Isolation transformers are low-power transformers used to isolate the primary and secondary windings completely without affe 14-Isolation Transformer Inverter transformers are used in inverter circuits such as power conversion inverters. 13-Inverter Transformer Control transformers are used in electronic circuits or systems that require constant voltage or constant current. 12-Industrial Control Transformer ï¿½ï¿½Impedance matching transformers are used to interface two different devices or circuits in order to provide common impedance. In general these types of transformers have a 1:1 turn rati 11-Impedance Matching Transformer High-voltage transformers are used in situations where a high voltage is needed. 10-High-Voltage Transformer ï¿½ï¿½Generator step-up (GSU) power transformers are used to increase the voltage from a power generator to the desired higher voltage. They are normally located in a power statio 9-GSU Transformer ï¿½ï¿½Flyback transformers (FBT) or line output transformers (LOPT) are transformers that are designed to produce a very high output voltage (no 8-Flyback Transformer (FBT) ï¿½ï¿½Encapsulated transformers have a protective coating of cured plastic or other encapsulant which encloses the unit and provides weatherproofin 7-Encapsulated Transformers Current or voltage transformers used as measuring instruments in the electronics industry. 6-Electronics Transformer ï¿½ 5-Distribution Transformer ï¿½ï¿½Encapsulated coil transformers have windings that are solidly cast in resin under a vacuum in a mold. This manufacturing process covers the transformer w 4-Encapsulated Coil ï¿½ï¿½Buck-boost transformers are used to make small changes to a voltage. Typical usage is for distribution power or power supply transformer 3-Buck-Boost Transformer ï¿½ï¿½Bar current transformers are toroidal transformers with a bus bar permanently inserted through the window of the toroid. The bus bar serves as the primary conductor. Bar transformers are inserted directly int 2-Bar Transformer ï¿½ï¿½Autotransformers are a special type of power transformer that only has one winding. By tapping or connecting at certain points along the winding different voltages can be obtained. Autotransformers are generally used in low-power application 1-Autotransformer ï¿½ï¿½The ladder configuration is a model used with multiple winding transformers. A ladder transformer consists of windings in a cascade and a series of inductances connected between adjacent winding 5-Ladder ï¿½ï¿½Single-phase transformers with 5-lead voltage selectors can accept five possible nominal voltages. The primary winding is arranged so that it can accept the 5 voltage rating 4- 5-Lead ï¿½ï¿½Single-phase transformers that use the quad (2+2) configuration have dual windings in the primary side where each winding has a tap for accepting two nominal voltage 3- Quad (2+2) ï¿½ï¿½Single-phase transformers with dual configuration have dual windings in the primary side and can accept two nominal voltages. This configuration helps to reduce fault current levels. A 2-lead voltage selector must be provide 2- Dual ï¿½ï¿½Single-phase transformers with single configuration have only one winding in the primary side and can accept only one nominal voltag 1- Single ï¿½ï¿½The size and cost of a transformer increases with the number of leads. A 5-lead primary requires more copper than a quad (2+2) primary. A ladder is the least economical primary configuratio Other unlisted or proprietary cooling method. 4-Other The transformer is cooled with water. 3-Water ï¿½ï¿½In oil-filled power transformers the winding and core are immersed in oil to keep the transformer cool. Oil is also used as an insulato 2-Oil Filled ï¿½8Air-cooled or dry-type transformers do not have a core 1-Dry-type / Air Cooled The primary is rated only for 400 Hz (aerospace). 4- 400 Hz The primary is rated for both 50 and 60 Hz. 3- 50 / 60 Hz The primary is rated only for 60 Hz. 2- 60 Hz The primary is rated only for 50 Hz. 1- 50 Hz Frequency of incoming voltage signal to primaries. ï¿½AThe maximum primary voltage rating is the input voltage range o ï¿½s In all types of transformers core is constructed by assembling (stacking) laminated sheets of steel with mini ï¿½ï¿½Basically a transformer consists of two inductive windings and a laminated steel core. The coils are insulated from each other as well as from the steel core. A transformer may also consist of Basic Construction Of Transformer ï¿½Th ï¿½ï¿½The basic principle behind working of a transformer is the phenomenon of mutual induction between two windings linked by common magnetic flux. The figure at right shows the simplest form of a transformer. Basically a transformer consists of two in Working principle Of transformer 7- International 7- International The primary winding uses a delta configuration and the secondary winding uses a single-phase configuration with one winding. 6- Delta - Single-Phase The primary winding uses a wye configuration and the secondary winding uses a single-phase configuration with one winding. 5- Wye (Y) - Single Phase The primary winding uses a wye configuration and the secondary winding uses a delta configuration. 4- Wye (Y) - Delta Both the primary winding and the secondary winding use a wye configuration. 3- Wye (Y) - Wye (Y) The primary winding uses a delta configuration and the secondary winding uses a wye configuration. 2- Delta - Wye (Y) Both the primary winding and the secondary winding use a delta configuration. 1- Delta - Delta ï¿½8Three phase transformers are connected in delta or wye With direct current (DC) secondary voltage output consult the manufacturer for the type of rectification. ï¿½ï¿½Alternating current (AC) waveform output voltage values are typically expressed as RMS values. Consult the manufacturer for waveform option 4- Output Voltage Full required range of ambient operating temperature. 4- Operating Temperature: The rated power of the transformer is the sum of the VA (volts x amps) for all of the secondary windings. 3- Power Rating (VA) This is the rated output current. 2- Maximum Secondary Current Rating ï¿½.The maximum secondary voltage rating is the 1- Maximum Secondary Voltage Rating The transformer can be used outdoors. 3- Outdoor Use The transformers enclosure satisfies NEMA standards 2- NEMA Enclosure The transformer has a waterproof case. 1- Waterproof
